title: Promoting the Export of the American AI Technology Stack

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the U.S. government to promote and support the global export of fully integrated American artificial intelligence technologies. It establishes a program to fund and prioritize industry proposals that package AI hardware, software, security, and applications for export to allied countries, aiming to strengthen U.S. leadership in AI and reduce reliance on technologies from adversaries.
potential_concerns: The order could create unfair competitive advantages for selected large industry consortia over smaller or emerging AI companies.
Exporting advanced AI technology might increase risks of technology transfer to adversaries despite export controls, compromising national security.
Implementation complexity and interagency coordination challenges may delay the programâ€™s effectiveness.
The order prioritizes allied countries but may strain trade or diplomatic relations with adversaries excluded from export opportunities.
Federal financing tools used may expose taxpayers to financial risks if supported AI export projects fail commercially.
